1.text: Wisdom built her house, she hewed out her seven pillars:

2.text: She slaughtered her slaughter; she mingled her wine; also she prepared her table.

3.text: She sent forth her girls: she will call upon the wings of the heights of the city,

4.text: Who the simple, he shall turn aside here: he wanting heart, she said to him,

5.text: Come ye, eat of my bread, and drink ye of the wine I mingled.

6.text: Forsake ye the foolish, and live; and go straight in the way of understanding.

7.text: He instructing him mocking received to himself dishonor: and he reproving to the unjust one, his blemish.

8.text: Thou shalt not reprove him mocking, lest he shall hate thee: reprove to the wise one and he will love thee.

9.text: Thou shalt give to the wise one and he will be more wise: make known to the just one and he will add receiving.

10.text: The beginning of wisdom is the fear of Jehovah, and the knowledge of the holy ones is understanding.

11.text: For in me thy days shall be multiplied, and years of life shall be added to thee.

12.text: If thou wert wise, thou wert wise for thyself: and thou mockedst, thou alone shalt suffer.

13.text: A woman of folly being noisy, simple, and she knew not anything.

14.text: And sitting at the door of her house, upon the throne of the heights of the city,

15.text: To call to those passing the way, making straight their paths:

16.text: Who is simple, he shall turn aside here: and he wanting heart, and she said to him,

17.text: Stolen waters will be sweet, and the bread of secrets shall be pleasant.

18.text: And he knew not that there the shades; her called ones in the depths of hades.
